name: High Protein Black Chickpea Dosa
instructions: Soak black chickpeas overnight. Ensure they are soft and well-puffed.
Strain the soaked chickpeas and transfer them to a grinder.
Add ginger, green chillies, garlic, cumin, salt, coriander, semolina, curd, curry leaves, and water to the grinder.
Grind the mixture into a smooth batter.
Let the batter rest for at least 20 minutes. For a healthier version, soak the chickpeas until they sprout before following the recipe.
Heat a pan until it is hot and clean it properly.
Pour the batter in the center of the pan and spread it in a quick sweeping motion.
Cook the dosa on the lower side until it gets a nice color.
Drizzle oil or ghee on the dosa and ensure it cooks well from the bottom.
Flip the dosa once the edges turn brown.
Optionally, add stuffing on top of the dosa before folding it.
Fold the dosa and serve hot.

name: Curd Chutney
instructions: Take garlic, green chillies, salt, and cumin in a grinding tool. Optionally, roast the cumin for added flavor.
Grind the mixture well using a silbatta, mixer grinder, or Dori Danda.
Add chopped mint and coriander to the ground mixture for easier grinding.
Sprinkle a little more salt and a pinch of turmeric before grinding again.
Mix the ground chutney into thick curd.
Grate a peeled cucumber and add it to the curd mixture.
To enhance the flavor, drizzle a little raw mustard oil (optional).
Mix everything together thoroughly.
Serve the chutney with dosa, paratha, or any other dish as it complements them well.
